website_summaries.verdict: Compact, easy-to-store sous vide immersion cooker that’s quieter and more precise than much of the competition.
pros: Can heat from 32 to 197 degrees and provides 0.1-degree accuracy
Offers Bluetooth connectivity that allows you to control the cooker via your smartphone even if you’re up to 30 feet away
cons: Can take a while to heat a large pot of water
Some users find the temperature controls can be spotty

website_summaries.verdict: If you want to try sous vide cooking, there is no better place to start than with this product from Anova.
pros: Designed for beginner and professional chefs alike
Control your cooking via its speedy Bluetooth connection
cons: There is a bit of a learning curve to using this sous vide

customer_reviews.title: Like it!
customer_reviews.text: I decided on this new model because 1.) old model was on backorder and 2.) old model had condensation issues that I hoped would be resolved. I’ve used this three times now and so far, so good. Because it’s only 750 watts it’ll take longer to get up to temp, but apparently that’s the trade-off for the smaller size. It took 30 minutes to go from cold tap water to 130 degrees. However, if you start with hot water you get there much more quickly. Really enjoying this cooking process.
customer_reviews.author: c.cash

customer_reviews.title: No need to read the instructions: plug it in, press + to set the temp and press go.
customer_reviews.text: I love product design which is intuitive. The bottom of the face of the unit has a big plus and minus and a play / pause button. I attached it to the side of the pot, filled the pot with hot water, set the temp and hit the play button and it started up. No messing around with Wifi or Bluetooth. That's how easy it was to cook my steak today to a perfect 127 degrees. Tomorrow is pork tenderloin to 140... Did I say how quiet it is? Its very quiet. This is off to a great start!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Okin

customer_reviews.title: Got broken up by the 3rd time.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get my anova nano and start cooking daily with it. But by the third time I turned it on it started making VERY LOUD NOISES in a way that it was impractical to let it turned on. I'm very disappointed because in my country the price of this device is very expensive and now I have a broken device that was really expensive to use me.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Venancio Pinheiro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste money with this garbage device.
customer_reviews.text: Third time I used Nano and already having issues. When I push start button the device turns off. Really upset with this item because it’s the second devide I bought from Anova, the 1st one worked for 15 months and just died. Now I gor this and with 2 uses the device is already having hard issues. I’ll never buy anything from Anova anymore, don’t worth the price I paid and they don’t offer repair service. As I already knew the company don’t offer repair service I bought extra warranty but I will not need because it still has the 1 year warranty. But I don’t want another device, I just want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: E. Vanzela

customer_reviews.title: Dead on! Thermapen Test.
customer_reviews.text: The photo says it all. I put this ANOVA NANO to the test with the leading name in thermometers, the Thermoworks Thermapen. ANOVA advertises +/- 0.2°F precision and they delivered. When placing the Thermapen probe directly beside the output of the ANOVA, you see the exact same temperatures as the ANOVA display to the tenth of a degree. The temperature never fluctuates beyond 0.2° in our 12" stainless steel try ply pot. I highly recommend this sous vide cooker. Insta @TheUnfinishedKitchen
customer_reviews.author: curtis apgar

customer_reviews.title: Faulty water level sensor makes the Anova Nano useless
customer_reviews.text: I've only gotten the device to work once since receiving it. No matter how deeply it is submerged (see picture), I still get a 'Lo' error message. The app is pointless, as well. Just use the controls on the device. Skip this one for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ambos

customer_reviews.title: First experience gone bad
customer_reviews.text: This was a total disaster.Ad says sold by & shipped by Amazon.Neither was true.Bought 4 year warranty for $9.99.Not true either as my bill was $70-79.99.Cannt explain this.Now I try 2 make the ‘perfect steak’. Guess what???Thing didn’t work as water never heated.Just spent hour on phone & it looks like credit card will be adjusted once someone receives it back.Don’t know who someone is.Was told to give this code to UPS . There wasn’t any paper work included in shipping box.
customer_reviews.author: John mccutcheon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with perfect results
customer_reviews.text: The Sous Vide is very easy to use. Just put in your pot of water, plug it in, set the temperature and put your plastic bag with the meat in the water. Push the button and the Anova Sous Vide goes to work. About 40 min later it was at temperature, 129'. I waited another 30 minutes or so until the veggies were ready than seared the steak on a hot grill for about 1 minute a side. Absolutely perfect and tasted great. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ingham

customer_reviews.title: Both of them are amazing based on my experience goes with the sous vides
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting for this almost a year. I used both the previous model and this one. Both of them are amazing based on my experience goes with the sous vides. It is very easy to use and looks so fancy. Good job Anova!
customer_reviews.author: V. O.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect
customer_reviews.text: The Anova can only cook if you are able to connect it to your phone. Steak was in the bag ready to go and I was unable to connect to my phone. "This only takes a minute. Unable to connect , try again." 2 hours later I Turned the grill on. The app does no good to help connect. Try this now try that. I thought I was a patient person but 2 hours of trying all available options I just packed it up and sent it back. No more blutooth for me, I want a button or dial.
customer_reviews.author: susan swiatek

customer_reviews.title: If I Had to Do it Again
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Produced great steak on first attempt . I really enjoy it. Appears well made and have had zero issues with it. HOWEVER: if I had to purchase a Sous Vide cooker again I would not get one controlled by Bluetooth/smartphone. I would get a manual one... turn it on and set the time manually (monoprice has one). But that is a personal preference and not an indication of the performance of the Anova
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: A perfect small Sous Vide utensil
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my Power Pressure XL bowl to cook two chicken breasts and a small boneless pork chop. It was much more convenient that using the big pot and my bigger Anova machine. 140 degrees and 2.5 hours later I’ve got three perfectly cooked juicy pieces of meat for my jambalaya. When it was done I checked the water temp of Anova’s reading with my thermometer - there was a .2 degree variance. Not bad. Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.author: PRB

customer_reviews.title: Good for thick meat cuts
customer_reviews.text: I'm just not properly tuned into this thing. But I don't find many foods that it cooks better than I can do in my instant pot or on my stove. I think it is best for cooking thick pieces of meat. And it does give consistent levels of doneness according to the temperature set. But the whole idea of not having the meat be browned properly bothers me. I do brown it after use, but I can never get the degree of Browning that I need for flavorful meals. It works wonderfully however with the recipes on your phone connected by Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H

customer_reviews.title: Great results, but VERY short life span. Wears out FAST!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for a few months and gotten great results, however it has began making REALLY loud, pulsing, screeching noises. I thought maybe it was just resonate vibrations, but switched the container and padded the clamp, hoping to eliminate the noise. No luck. On closer examination i think one of the bearings on the impeller shaft has worn out... sent an email to support and will update this review once I've heard from them. Hope I just got a bad unit, and not all of them are like this... as it seems like its not built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now. Thank me later.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh I love this thing. I cook tons of stuff with this since I have discovered sous vide. I’ve taken it to friends houses for events or dinners to show them how it works and everyone is always amazed at how juicy and delicious everything is. I consider myself a great cook and this is just another tool in the arsenal. There have been a few occasions where Ive not been paying attention and accidentally over cooked my steaks on the grill (alcohol may have been involved) but I’m telling you this thing makes cooking a perfect steak absolutely impossible to mess up. I won’t cook one any other way than this. It is perfection every time.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: 1hr tender steaks, Juicy chicken. I'm not sure how I ever lived without it. I kept hearing my friends talk about their Sous Vide setups and I was on the fence for the longest time due to cost. Due yourself a favor and just buy this to get you started. No need to drop a ton of extra cash on the vacuum sealer and plastic balls. You will need some clamps to clamp your zip lock bags to the pot. Really, that's all you need. Save you money on the extras to buy yourself a decent cut of meat.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: timer
customer_reviews.text: Arrived prebroken. No need to do anything on your own. Followed instructions not included with the unit and would not work right out the box. No need to wait weeks for the failure.
customer_reviews.author: margaret nelson

customer_reviews.title: Makes better than restaurant steaks
customer_reviews.text: Got my Anova Sous Vide for Christmas and am loving it. We have done steaks, ribs, brisket, pumpkin pie filling, and eggs thus far. The meats are insane, we haven't bothered to go out for steaks simply because the ones I make are now better than anything I can get in a restaurant. Advice for new users - this is not a fast cooking method. Plan ahead! Don't use extremely lean cuts of meat, this needs the fat to self braise. You can drain the fat of later easily. For most foods at lower than about 160 f, Ziploc bags work just fine. The good eats guides to sous vide are really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: OMG Sous Vide - I am in love
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try to make some Christmas gifts with infused burbon. Starting experimenting with a steak and it was incredible. Then moved on to pork chops which I have never cared for my whole life because they never tasted good and no matter how I prepared them they were dry. Well sous vide to the rescue. Best pork chops I have ever eaten in my life. And I used to raise my own pigs years ago. I am thrilled with the device and I just bought another one for my brother for Christmas. Outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: MARY

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, much poorer than older unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this while I tried to get parts for my older unit (couldn't; they don't stock parts for a 2 year old $200 appliance) and have been using it since. This is MUCH noisier than the old unit. It has a rattle that makes me suspicious that it is going to burn out a bearing and it whines in a really annoying fashion when it gets above about 125 degrees. IF you can get one of the older ones do so. Mine just has a power cord problem that I will fix with a soldering gun. And then I can deep six this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Pay the extra money and get the bluetooth feature. You have to set this yourself. Not the end of the world, but I bought for my brother and he likely has used it since I last saw him in January given that it's not as easy as the one I have. I LOVE sous vide cooking, and was trying to convert him, but should have just made the better investment.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for a Good Sous Vide Circulator
customer_reviews.text: It's almost hard to believe some of the negative reviews. Got this at a great price to try out sous vide and I'm hooked. The Anova Nano works flawlessly and is incredibly accurate--I've double checked temps with my Thermapen and it's never off the mark. I wish the side clip were movable, but that's a minor thing. Easy to use and the food is great. I have a new fondness for pork chops--they come out so tender and flavorful. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AZHomeChef

customer_reviews.title: Easy Sous Vide
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use, clean and store. The wifi app offers recipe selections. I have made beef, vegetables and pork. A favorite is Trader Joe's Balsamic Tri-tips. re-vacuum sealed. I have used it with my own pots and also with the Anova container and generic container. I recommend for long term cooking the silicone lid pot cover to keep the water from evaporating. My only complaint would be the alarm when the cooking is over is very low so I have to set a second timer. That said I have not fooled around enough with the app. It is possible it allows adjustable volume. An item I like so much I gift it to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: mountain girl

customer_reviews.title: My Second Anova Sous Vide Cooker. I'm Hoping For The Best
customer_reviews.text: I had a more expensive Anova Sous Vide cooker with higher wattage and it only lasted for six weeks before it ceased maintaining a constant temperature. I knew I was taking a risk by purchasing another Anova Sous Vide Cooker but so far, after a month of use every two or three days, it is still working. It does take notably longer than the other one to heat water in the cooking container but I am willing to adjust my schedule. Perhaps I was foolish to buy another Anova product after such bad luck with my first one but they are highly recommended and I decided to take the chance on a less expensive, less powerful model. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Perry M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Sous Vide
customer_reviews.text: I really like this sous vide. In hindsight I wish I had gone with the higher power version because it takes a while to get the water up to temperature. I didn’t because of the large cost difference. I also think that the timer should shut it off once it’s done. The timer beeps but it does not shut the unit off at the end.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: BEST THING EVER
customer_reviews.text: I currently am a college student who needed a way to cook in an apartment that offered no stove. BOOM the Anova Nano does the job perfectly. No instructions needed after just a bit of research. Great features and recipes makes it super easy to cook up anything you could ever want. Have not had any issues with the temperature at all. Sound is minimal nearly non existent with any other noise around. Great quality product I will use for years for numerous items. Chicken, Beef,Pork,Veggies you name it. Would recommend to anyone needing help in cooking as a beginner and should be standard for any College Student kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Austin harrison

customer_reviews.title: NO customer service - my new sous vide is a brick!
customer_reviews.text: I used my sous vide 2 times with great results. The 3rd time I turned it on, I got the red light that indicates a malfunction. According to Anova the only thing I can do is "Contact customer service immediately and do not use your Anova Precision® Cooker any further." I've tried multiple time to contact customer service as directed. On hold for 5 minutes, then asked to leave a message. So far, no return call. So I have a brand new device that is as useful as a brick. General message
customer_reviews.author: Denise Resnikoff

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far.  I just wish the clamp was height adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked great to cook steaks. The unit seems really solid, is relatively quiet (just a small whine/hum from the circulator) and sleek. I do wish, however, that the clamp was height adjustable. I use it in a 12 qt container, and when it's propped on the side, I pretty much have to have the whole 12 quarts of water in the container to keep the level within the max/min line. When only cooking one steak, it would be more convenient to drop it closer to the bottom of the container and use less water.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning the build up is virtually impossible
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this, you MUST clean in vinegar water and/or detergent mixed water after every use. IF you get any build up, the lower casing is not able to be removed and the build up with stay on. Previous machines I owned had the ability to be clean thoroughly and didn't require as much maintenance, but this one, unfortunately requires that you have the cleaning bath ready to go next to it every time. I use it a lot so this extra cleaning step makes it annoying. Even than, it won't be a thorough cleaning and slowly but surely the build up will happen and you won't be able to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Only used about 6 times so far but food turning out great. Nice tender roasts. You do want to get a lid to go over your stock pot to keep water from evaporating. I've used it for 6-48 hours with lots of luck. A lot is trial and error to figure out since thickness and cut help determine the best time. 135* always gives a perfect med (pink all the way through). I cooked frozen solid 3 1/2" roast for 48 hours ... it was so tender its almost falling apart. Nice to put it in and just forget about it, with silicone lid I didn't have to add water at all during 48 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Vkesu

customer_reviews.title: This changed the way I cook forever.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of it (real easy to get started) and look on YouTube for methods and sous vide recipes, you will be amazed at what you can do. I even saw a guy make queso blanco (type of cheese) with it. Although you can use ziplock bags and force the air out of them after inserting your food, I highly recommend getting a device like the Foodsaver to vacuum seal special bags. And I can't stress it enough, look on YouTube to see all the possibilities and proper techniques - it will save you a whole lot of trouble by learning from the mistakes and successes of others.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Roach

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm thrilled for the price. Fit most pots I have, a smaller cooler i have works perfect for counter top. Started a "roast" that takes 30hrs about 7 hrs ago and been easy smooth sailing so far. Hooked right up to my android s9 over bluetooth with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This sous vide is very easy to use! Follow the instructions and you have food cooked to the proper temperature! It beeps when you get up to temperature. Haven’t used the Bluetooth feature yet. Cooked steaks for a party and everyone was wowed with how great the meat tasted. The chimichurri sauce I made was also good, but the temp on the steaks was definitely a huge factor. Would like to make fish next! My friend made fish with a sous vide and it was soooo succulent! I want to utilize this for vegetables too. Tried carrots and it wasn’t that exciting.
customer_reviews.author: aDORAblexplorer

customer_reviews.title: A Whole New Level of Cooking !
customer_reviews.text: I pulled it out of box clamp on the big pan . I used a 22qt because I’m doing a beef brisket. Put in reusable vacuum bag . Clipped it to the sides of pan so ziplock isn’t in water. I than placed Reynolds wrap on top of the pan to cover than placed heavy glass lid to hold meat down. Plugged in unit set timer for 12hours . Set temp for 145°. . Hit arrow to start . Away I went with Precision Cooking . After these 12 hours than I’ll smoke meat 6-8 hours. My Twin brother has used this very unit for over two years ! Finally jumped on the band wagon!
customer_reviews.author: Trixbus

customer_reviews.title: Great new twist on the cooking experience.
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting fool-proof results with meals that can otherwise be a bit tricky. Flawless salmon, set-and-forget cod loins, the best pork chops I've EVER had, and that's just this week. I've also been using it to make Greek yogurt from on-sale milk. A little putzy to start up, as all yogurt is. And the draining part takes a while too. But I can control the ferment temperature to within a degree, and the results are perfect. Two quarts of Greek yogurt for $1.50? Yes please.
customer_reviews.author: Marquette Co. Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Best Sous Vide for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever sous vide, and I LOVE IT! Steaks and chicken and whatnot come out perfect every time, and I can get a much higher depth of flavor it blows my mind. The biggest seller (for me) is that I can finally cook fish. I always seem to overcook it, no matter how careful I am so it's nice that now I don't have to try as hard. I will say, if you're looking to cook quickly, this isn't the right product, nor is any form of sous vide. Just common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t circulate straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Shame on Anova. Water wouldn’t circulate straight out of the box. And this was after I’d already sealed up a $25 cut of meat. Amazon is sending another but I don’t know why I’m bothering. Amazon or Anova should some how make this right by me. Also, very poorly written instructions that didn’t include info for some kind of hard factory reset.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet, heat was maintained to with a tenth of a degree. So far we've used it 4 times, twice for large 11lb prime rib roasts. Once you try cooking a prime rib with this, in this way, you will never oven roast again. The unit has worked flawlessly each time. It's so quiet you will wonder whether it's working. You can then see the water circulating and of course the temp. Very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: walter

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooking method!
customer_reviews.text: My first recommendation is to learn as much as possible about the sous vide method of cooking. This circulator is a bit noisy but overall I am very happy with it if you don't need all the bells and whistles (WiFi). The Bluetooth feature is nice and the circulator can be programmed from the unit itself or your smartphone once you download the Anova app. My only complaint is the mounting bracket is not adjustable so you have to fill up the water container almost to the top. Would I buy it again? Heck Yea!
customer_reviews.author: fyurguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: After years of hearing about how great sous vide cooking is I finally pulled the trigger on this unit and it really does live up to the hype. Super easy to set up and the app provides a ton of recipes to use. *When using the app, though, keep in mind you may not find a recipe that fits exactly the size/weight of what you have to cook. I just look a number of recipes and average out cook time and temperatures and have had no issues. My favorite items to cook are thick steaks, rib roasts, and Boston Butt for pulled pork.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Limited expectation
customer_reviews.text: Plus or minus 1.5° on average. Experimented with eggs over 9 times. Still haven't reach a consistent egg. As a result, I am hesitant to try cooking large chunks of meat like a shoulder. I'll do it anyways....I bought it with the hopes that the hype would be met. I will be trying out meat, but precision so far is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad app
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to Sous Vide, so I researched a lot about these machines to be able to cook what I wanted, I think this is one of the best considering its capabilities and the price. It has worked great in everything I've done, I've cooked for big parties and it's very easy to use, if I had to change something, it would be the handle to raise it or lower it a bit, but I do not think it's a problem, i would also improve the application wich is very bad, apart from that I am very happy and I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: ArturoN

customer_reviews.title: Buy this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing. Absolutely superb way to cook meats. Literally a set and forget system that gives perfect...and I mean perfect results. Super simple to use. Bright easy to read display. Decently small form factor. It doesn't have a way to adjust height...but since this is only a 750W unit...its designed for smaller containers. Temp control on this model is excellent. Bluetooth connects quick. Bear in mind...its not a wifi model so it will lose connection to your phone through multiple walls. I don't find it that big of a deal. It is a sub $100 unit that can hang with its bigger brothers.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Nano for a couple weeks now and cooked about 6 meals. All I can say is everything has turned out great. My wife was a skeptic at first, but now she is asking what we are going to make next. Roasts we usually cook in the crock pot come out way more juicy and tender. I picked up a $30 weed torch at Harbor Freight to do the searing and it works great. The unit feels sturdy and well built. The only thing so far is that I wish the clamp was a little beefier. It seems it should be more stout. Bottom line, get one!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Crocher

customer_reviews.title: Good Value if on Sale
customer_reviews.text: If you can get this on sale it is definitely a good value. Have had it more than six months and used it a bunch of times. Easy to use and obviously nothing to clean except to try it off. The bluetooth is not super reliable with the app on my iPhone, but the manual controls work just fine and are simple to set, although the timer is easiest to set on the app. Would buy again or one similar.
customer_reviews.author: bdprime

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, but not all recipes in the App work well
customer_reviews.text: This unit circulation is quiet compared to others I have used. Not all suggested recipes in the App work better or as well compared to conventional method. Beef/steaks recipes work well, but pork and chicken did not. Need to experiment with time/temperature combination a lot, and still it may not work. Major Minus: App requires registration to save suggested recipes as "favorites." Don't see why it is necessary to give them any information for this.
customer_reviews.author: D. leung

customer_reviews.title: 7 months old and NOT holding temperature
customer_reviews.text: VERY disappointing. I'd planned on buying one of these for both my adult children, but after only 7 mos, when I turn it on, it turns itself off saying "water is too low"...but the water is not too low. I have to stay and "babysit" it, continually turning it back on, until...it FINALLY holds and begins to heat. I'm not sure how long it will actually last; I'm expecting it too stop heating all together soon. Then, I'm not sure which sous vide cooker I'll buy, but it will NOT be this one!
customer_reviews.author: Dkgoodman

customer_reviews.title: JUST BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: Is it weird cooking food in a bag? Of course it is! But holy crap...this makes AMAZING FOOD. It comes out looking like a sad tater tot, but once you sear it, it transforms into the love child of a boutique steakhouse. And once you start putting herbs and what not in there, you’ll never cook meat like a normal person ever again! Just do it! Cook your meat in a bag. And buy the little bundle Amazon recommends. The plastic lid thing and the big bin work great, and you won’t look like a noob.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: This item came and never worked. I tried it several times. Looked up the error, messaged customer service and received nothing in return. It’s too late to return it and now I’m down 100$. It’s apparently a very common problem where it will stop working because it thinks the water level is low. Do not waste your money on this like I did.
customer_reviews.author: boogiemonsta

customer_reviews.title: Great value, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. I cheated out and bought a lower priced knock off first which was DOA. Returned it and purchased this one. I’m very glad the knock of broke. This one is sturdier just feels like a better product. I do hot side and cold side restaraunt repairs for a living. I used a high end calibration temperature and was surprised to see the temperature reading was within .1°F. This is a very accurate, underpriced product. The app works very well. I have yet to have any connectivity issues. I use the app on an iPhone 10xr. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Brand new and can’t get this to work without receiving the “Lo” error. Water all the way to the max line. Very disappointed and cannot recommend. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: Needs its own power supply. Made my lights flicker.
customer_reviews.text: My light flickered when this was plugged in. I tried using the lamp and that flickered as well. Come to find out it was this thing. You need to plug it in a circuit that it's the only thing on because it has a large voltage pull.
customer_reviews.author: ansari

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Low water warning that prevents the Sous Vide from working. Product would not function! The app and Bluetooth worked well, but the Sous Vide was defective out of the box. I Googled the problem and it seems this is a common problem with this product. Sent in for a refund and purchased a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob G.

customer_reviews.title: Take Your Cooking to Another Level
customer_reviews.text: This slick sous vide cooker adds a level of class to your kitchen while also help you take cooking to another "delicious" level. You control the device via Bluetooth with a phone app that has many recipes and tips, and adjustment (if needed) can be made on the touch-screen panel on the cooker. Sous vide cooking is made easy if you have a deep pot and ziplock bags. I cooked several pieces of sirloin and ribeye sealed in a bag with salt, pepper and garlic, and in about 4 hours, the medium-done meat is so tender and moist. I don't even need a steak knife!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Lee

customer_reviews.title: Total game CHANGER!
customer_reviews.text: My in-laws always get us Omaha Steaks for the holidays and this year we "got smart" and stopped guessing how long to cook at what temperature. This is hands down the best and easiest way to cook to perfection and we will never over/under cook steaks again.
customer_reviews.author: Sewing Fool

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!
customer_reviews.text: Cooked a couple of prime ribs and hams. My guests couldn't believe how good it was. Someone wanted it slightly more done so a slice was place in a pan for a minute and viola. Still had the juiciness of the med-rare joint. Didn't bother with the browning of the outside. Just cut it and they never noticed as the inside looked stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a clever little addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Anova. It has made sou vide cooking accessible without taking up valuable kitchen counter real estate. I've cooked many a delicious meal with this gadget and look forward to many more. It's especially handy when cooking a meal for dinner guests as you can hold the main course for several hours if you need to until you're ready to finish your protein in the skillet before serving. It has become an essential part of my culinary arsenal!
customer_reviews.author: R. Medina

customer_reviews.title: sealer not perfect, but works
customer_reviews.text: if you don't align the bag perfectly flat if will not seal 100%. simple solution is seal a second time a little above the first seal. if you are sealing something with liquids they will spill into the vacuum compartment. disinfecting helps but if the liquids get sucked into the raised vacuum port you cant do much about it. the cooker itself is great, one thing i find is because it circulates water putting bags against it will limit the flow and water at the far part of the pot may be a degree lower - just keep it unobstructed and u'll be fine (also 1 degree doesn't make a difference).
customer_reviews.author: dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Functions As Described
customer_reviews.text: We've only used the Anova Sous Vide once, so are hesitant to provide a max rating based on such limited use. That said, after finding the correct size pot (large soup pot seemed best), we used the device to cook tuna steaks which are best rare, but seared. They were perfect. We'd suggest searing the item to your preference; we found the recommended times for searing a bit short. Connectivity with my iPhone was seamless, but it worked just as well without it.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my kitchen in my LIFE!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a sous vide. Bought this one and it did not disappoint!! We use it 3-4 times a week. Can cook for hours and not heat up your kitchen which is important to me as I get migraines pretty easy. It's everything I had hoped for and more! For example, I was able to take this to work and cook a meal without fuss. It's easy enough that the kids feel comfortable using it. This is now my one item I grab in a fire item!
customer_reviews.author: Neutrogena06

customer_reviews.title: Made a killer roast
customer_reviews.text: I have another circulator/precision cooker/magical meat maker, and it is entirely app driven. While I have nothing but good things to say about that guy, I picked this up on a whim for reasons I won't elaborate on. I gave this guy the chance to prove itself on my Christmas roast, and it did a lovely job. The on unit display and controls made it very handy to transition from cooking to warming in a cinch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ahlering

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sous vide but it was suggested to me to start with from a friend whom has plenty of sous vide experience. The unit is sleek, easy to use and the display is large enough you can read it from across the room. I use it two to three times a week and I love it
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Had this a few months now and love the outcome of everything cooked with it. From steaks, chicken, pork chops, fish, even tried a dessert or two, flavor has been nothing short of amazing. With the app, you can control to the tenth of a degree, or with the Anova itself, you can adjust in half degree increments. A little tip though, when you go to sear the final product, do it outside if possible! I typically use a cast iron pan with some oil or butter in it, hot as I can get it. The pan smoke A LOT and can set off the smoke alarms.
customer_reviews.author: The W's

customer_reviews.title: The verdict is still out
customer_reviews.text: I like the Anova Sous Vide but my husband does not and he is the one who cooks all the meats. He used it and did not feel it was worth the hassle when he could just grill the meat in half the time. I used it to cook a large chicken breast and the breast was so tender and moist. Before when I cooked a chicken breast it was dry and really not worth eating. I'm going to keep the Sous Vide because it allows me to cook meat. I just have to try different types of meat. It was definitely easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the Bluetooth portion of this thing, so I can't review that so much. What I have done is turn the thing on with various things in the water such as cheap sirloin from the grocery store, and I ended up with sirloin you could cut with a fork. My only problem with this is that I didn't buy one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Rix86

customer_reviews.title: Perfect the first time.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I purchased a 12 quart container with a lid designed to fit the Anova cooker. I wasn’t expecting the first steaks I cooked to turn out as hoped. But the Anova was so simple to use; I also downloaded the app. Our first steaks were 1” thick rib eyes and they were absolutely perfect. I’ve been cooked steaks that were this tasty and cooked to perfection. The Anova cooker is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: R. WiseTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool!
customer_reviews.text: So this is my first attempt at Sous Vide. My initial impression of the cooker is very good. Definitely a cool gadget! Extremely intuitive and easy to set up. Maintains a PRECISE temperature. The bluetooth connection is handy too. Just need the right size bowl/container! Looking forward to preparing wild game!
customer_reviews.author: Spokane Smith

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a present and I couldn't be anymore happier. Its light weight and bring the water up to temperature pretty quick. A friend of mine got the Gourmia and we did a side by side "race" to see which would bring the water to temperature the fastest. With Gourmia being 1000W vs Anova 750W, it was obvious that Gourmia won the race but Anova wasn't too far behind. It was less then 10 minutes slower to bring the water to temperature. Overall, really great product at a great price. I would recommend this to anyone who would like to get into sous viding.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Tried it a few times and then gave up
customer_reviews.text: I heard about this method of poaching and thought I’d give it as shot but I was underwhelmed by this sous vide wand. The timer on the stick and the timer on my phone app go out of sync when I adjust the cooking time. Not a fan of the cooking in a bag method. Not easy to get enough air out of the bag to keep it from floating unless using a vacuum sealer but the sealer is tricky and tends to suck out all the butter and seasonings added to the food. This stays in the drawer most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa L.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, size is perfect for small family
customer_reviews.text: I had debated whether to get the Nano or the full sized model. Very happy that I went with the Nano. it is powerful enough, and works as advertised, and the food was delicious. The only complaint is that the bluetooth connectivity sometimes drops out. Most of the time, I don't bother to use the app.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it twice so far. Once for steaks and I cooked pork chops last night. The pork chops were so moist and tasty. I do tend to season heavily before bagging. I didn't season the steaks enough the first time I used it. I would suggest watching some videos for tips. Love it because I can start dinner very early and just about forget about it for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Raven

customer_reviews.title: Through this special tv offer...
customer_reviews.text: It’s the best investment small appliance in my kitchen. Don’t tell the coffee maker. Always yields fantastic steaks or chicken. Just finish it off on the grill or in a pan for some color. Always wows guests. They think I’m a chef. If it sounds like an infomercial, then that’s the point! But in all honesty it is fantastic and I use it whenever I can. Super easy and always consistent results.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Bedinghaus

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for cooking since the discovery of fire
customer_reviews.text: This product brings joy. Meal time has become super simple and extra delicious. I have used it dozens of times and the little guy is an absolute champ! I’ve taken cheap cuts, like eye round, and served them as beef Wellington and those I served had no idea it wasn’t tenderloin. Get this for the food nerd in your family and make them use it. Your belly and tastebuds will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly E Turner

customer_reviews.title: We love it and cook for family of 5 weekly with it
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life??? We use this weekly for the last several months and I highly recommend. Done several multi day cooks. No issues holding temp. I did get a square bowl and silicone lids to match this cooker. Just amazing and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie & Family

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last very long, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than Joule! Purchased this after my Joule finished driving me nuts by finally not connecting by Bluetooth any longer. It was always a pain in the but for me! This one is SO much easier! Plug it in, set your temp (ON THE DEVICE!) and walk away. LIfe is good. Update: lasted only 5 months before becoming unusable because it keeps shutting off! Forums filled with others having same experience. Time to try anothee brand!
customer_reviews.author: sip

customer_reviews.title: Best Steak!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!I was skeptical about getting an ANOVA from some reviews I read about connectivity and issues people were having but, none of those seem to be the case. It is extremely user friendly and easy to use. You can either control or from the device itself or with the app. I love it and use it at least 2x a week. It is great coming home to a steak that only need 5 min of prep to be finished and amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: This guy makes A lot of noise
customer_reviews.text: Great sous vide cooker. Has enough power to heat water at a decent rate in a 12 quart container. Going from 80 to 180 takes like an hour. Temp is accurate. Cooks food exceptionally well. Update(7/18/19): the water level sensor in mine is being weird it will just stop randomly and i have to start it like 50 times but then it cooks continuously for some reason? Going to contact manufacturer and see what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jwat

customer_reviews.title: Great changes in cooking.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I’m sure there are long reviews for this elsewhere. One of my coworkers told me about this brand and loves his. I bought one for my sone for Christmas. Ok got one for myself too. Right now making pork shoulder. Everything I’ve cooked comes out perfect ( except hard boiled eggs ). I’ll try it again. Steak and pork lovers fish too. You just can’t screw up dinner. Don’t know why you would spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Bought it when my second Nomiku bit the dust.
customer_reviews.text: Nomiku being out of business, I decided to go with what appears to be the most popular brand, on the presumption that if it's the most popular, there's a reason. So far, so good. Temperature control is very stable, ease of use is perfect, user guide is very clear, took me about five minutes to know how to operate it. At this point I don't know how durable it is since I just got it, but it looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Best cooking method PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: My brother first told me about this method of cooking, but I didn't listen. It wasn't until we went to my brother's dinner party and he cooked up sou vided TOMAHAWK steaks! OmG, the best of the best of the best ever! Ever since then we bought our own device and have been sou vide-ing EVERYTHING we can think of! I would def try it if I were you....
customer_reviews.author: Jasmin Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: NOTICED NOTHING DIFFERENT
customer_reviews.text: I used this sous vide on four different types of food from potatoes to a chuck tender roast. My last was the chuck tender roast (1 pound) which was sous vide for 29 hours at 135.5 degrees. When done I seared at 600 degrees in a cast iron pan on my bbq. RESULT: The meat was just average and not tender. When I make this roast in the oven for a much shorter time the roast is tenderer. I do not believe its the product in as much "Sous Vide" is over played.
customer_reviews.author: Meezers G'ma

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO WORK - COOKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: this is one of the easiest utensils to use. I especially like the fact that I can program it to come on at a certain time and start cooking. I turn it on from work and then my meat is done when I get home. You can keep the meat in the water cooking for a long time - it will not overcook! And the steaks are fantastic!!! Juiciest filet mignon we have ever had!! Chicken is juicy - everything is better - keeps the juice inside. Recommend trying it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great for steaks
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a good cook. At all. But I can make absolutely amazing steaks with this thing. Thick-cut ribeyes vacuum-packed with my food sealer and cooked until the app says they're done. Sear them in an iron skillet with some butter and garlic and voilà. Perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: NWA Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for cooking enthusiasts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband and he freaking loves it! He uses it at least 2-3 a week. Using the app, you can turn it on, set it to the desired emperature, and monitor your meat while away from the kitchen. We usually throw in a couple of steaks, chicken, or salmon, and leave it cooking for a few couple of hours. So far, everything turned out delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Sous Vide, yes.  Timer, no.
customer_reviews.text: Loving the sous vide function of this device. It's our first and the food we have cooked is fantastic. This sous vide does a great job of holding the water at the set temp but if you are hoping for a functioning timer then look somewhere else. They should consider repackaging this as a budget model and ditch the timer and bluetooth/app. 5 stars for the cooking element, 0 stars for the timer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Bad for rural users
customer_reviews.text: Bought last year for my Mom. Had no forewarning the app would not work offline, or that high speed internet with wifi was required to have full functionality & value. Internet here is dialup (26.4kbps, 3.2KB/s), no cell service. Returned unused after about a week. Note, this complaint may be out dated.
customer_reviews.author: MegaBurn

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Sous Vide cookers are a great addition to any kitchen. Price point is excellent, especially if you are unsure if you will using often. Can be a gift for the person who has everything. The Joule is better though, so if you have used a Sous Vide before or enjoy cooking go with that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Attention to Detail

customer_reviews.title: Buy one today!! You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life??? I have used this for almost every meal and it is amazing. I am notorious for my dry cooking and this makes that impossible, chicken cooked tender and juicy, pork loin, tender and juicy, steaks cooked consistently from side to side. This thing is a life saver and a money saver.
customer_reviews.author: SaberDad

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE our Sous Vide!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my husband. Was unsure how he would like it and what the quality of the meats would be with its use, and we were both beyond happy with the results. It is easy to set up and cook with, very little mess/clean-up and the steaks we cooked were the most tender we've both ever had. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: This is probably the one you want.
customer_reviews.text: The Anova Nano works perfectly. Easy to use, easy to control, handles multi-day cooks with no problems. I use it in a 12 qt tub - a friend uses the exact same model in a 16qt. No problems, no struggles whatsoever. If you're new to sous vide and wondering whether you need this one or the bigger one... you really don't need the bigger one, you just need this one. Take the money you save and invest in a good vacuum sealer - THAT'S the part that will do more to mess up your cooks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Moritz

customer_reviews.title: We love this Sous Vide Machine
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to convince the wife about Sous Vide but now she wont let me cook a steak without it! Have tried carrots too but mostly just meat. It is incredible how tender this makes even a good old NY strip! 2 hours at 129 then a hot skillet or grill for 11/2 to 2 minutes each side, perfectly medium rare every time!
customer_reviews.author: SunnyD65

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but Genius?  Seriously?
customer_reviews.text: This unit is both loud and under powered (takes for ever to get to temperature), which leaves you with a very bad impression of sous vide in the home. Most importantly, it only operates in Fahrenheit with no ability to shift to Celsius on the fly. There is another well know brand at this price point that is quiet, appropriately powered, and C/F flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once I have it, I cannot live without it.
customer_reviews.text: Sous vide is the way to go! Perfect cooking, easy to manage. I had a party for 20 people, and I managed to cook lamb chops, lamb legs, lamb shanks, fishes, shrimps, over 48 hours, to feed all of them, all by myself, with the help of this little tool. I just ordered another one for my corporate apartment in another city...
customer_reviews.author: X. HE

customer_reviews.title: My meat melts in your mouth
customer_reviews.text: This product has turned my meat into something stiff to something that just melts in the mouth. Bathed in warm water for what seems like hours, I can’t keep this meat out of my mouth! My family finally likes my meat.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: I have been really excited to use my new Nano. Greatly disappointed that after using it three times it failed!! Even after installing the Wi-Fi app, it failed to start and reverted to the default red light and flashing red light. For a dinner party of eight with New York 1 1/2 steaks and grilled shrimp it was a (deleted) disaster. Except for the quantity nothing that I could not have done on the grill and a very hot Lodge skillet. Very disappointed, next time I might use my water bath canner and a digital thermometer. Simply not worth the time (wait) and trouble and cost. Thank goodness for the local pizza shop !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: LOVE COOKING WITH THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I got this mainly to do steaks, and so far I have been really impressed with it's quality/stable temperature and ease of use. The bluetooth, though not necessary is a nice touch. The reason for only 4-stars is because I wish you could slide the clamp up or down depending on the depth of the water vessel. Other than that, it works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Farabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble deciding between the more expensive model and this one. The only difference I think there is, is that the higher prices model heats water faster. Heat the water yourself in a stock pot and it quickly gets it to the exact temp you want and keeps it there.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul Rea

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen did not work
customer_reviews.text: We were very excited about this item when we first bought it but when we tried it the touch screen did not work. We returned it and got a replacement which had the same problem. Controlling the machine is not that important to us. Seller should not sell this product until it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Minna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for short-haul cooking
customer_reviews.text: This little guy was honestly awesome. I used it several times for short periods of time (2-3 hours). The results were of course amazing. I also closely monitored the temperature of the water and it was always spot-on. The only complaint I have is... It is clearly not meant for long-haul cooking (8+ hours). I did an overnight job and later that day, did a regular short job. About an hour into the shorter one, the motor started whining. Guess this is why they sell the Pro version. So I bought that one. I am confident that I will now have no issue with long-haul cooking. Overall, this is a great product for your standard cooking times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I forgot how to cook on anything else
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this. The wireless settings are kinda meh. (everytime you leave Bluetooth range you have to re pair it) but the controls on the unit work great. The app (when connected) is awesome. You can find a recipe then set it from there. Just remember the finishing instructions to your dish!
customer_reviews.author: EugeneA

product_meta.title: Anova Culinary Sous Vide Precision Cooker Nano | Bluetooth | 750W | Anova App Included
product_meta.description: Style:NanoThe Anova Precision Cooker Nano makes it easy to achieve professional-level cooking results at home. To use, simply attach the cooker to any water-filled pot, put your food in a sealable bag, and set the time and temperature. The Anova Precision Cooker Nano heats and circulates the water to a precise temperature, cooking food to an exact temperature which creates maximum tenderness and moisture retention (without worry of overcooking). The Anova Precision Cooker Nano connects to your phone, so you can cook amazing meals by the touch of a button - spend less time tied to the kitchen by relying on the app to notify you when your food is ready to eat. Cook Time: up to 99 hours
feature_bullets: PERFECT RESULTS EVERY TIME: Never over or undercook your food again. The Anova Precision Cooker Nano sous vide (pronounced “sue-veed”) circulates water at the exact temperature required for perfectly cooked meals, no matter what's on your menu. Use the Anova App to access thousands of free recipes and monitor your cook from your phone via Bluetooth.

WHAT TO COOK: Sous vide cooking s the perfect level of doneness for nearly any food of your choosing. Chicken, fish, vegetables, eggs, beef, lamb, pork and more are all ideal candidates for sous vide circulation. The ability to lock in flavor and moisture during the cooking process results in texture and taste that is second to none.

SMALL BUT MIGHTY: At almost 2 inches smaller than the original Anova Precision Cooker, Nano is small enough to fit into your kitchen drawer for quick and easy storage, but powerful enough to prepare food for a table of four. Nano easily attaches to any stock pot or container with a fixed clamp, and is constructed of super durable plastic that's easy to clean.

EASY TO USE: Simply attach the Precision Cooker to your own pot or container, fill the pot or container with water, add your food in a sealed bag, and cook manually with the built-in controls or from your phone with the Anova App.

Customer experience: designed in San Francisco, CA. Anova delivers thousands of sous vide recipes for free in the Anova app, created for cooks of every skill level by award-winning chefs and home cooks alike
Included Components: 1 Anova Precision Cooker Nano

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,001 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
